news.title: Enoch Burke to resist paying school’s €600,000 legal bill
news.summary: Jailed teacher Enoch Burke will resist paying hundreds of thousands of euro in legal costs he owes and has indicated he intends to bring his dispute with Wilson’s Hospital School all the way to the Supreme Court.

news.title: Man (20s) dies during firearms incident in Carlow
news.summary: A man has died following what appears to be an accidental shooting in Co Carlow.

news.title: Rúaidhrí O’Connor: Ireland have never had a better chance to break World Cup glass ceiling as Scotland game looms large
news.summary: To paraphrase Mick McCarthy, Andy Farrell would have bitten your hand off for a scenario where his Ireland team had to beat Scotland and Argentina to reach a first World Cup semi-final, most likely against England.

news.title: Security worker withdraws injury claim against Supermac’s after CCTV shows he put up ‘wet-floor’ sign himself before he slipped and fell
news.summary: A security worker has withdrawn a personal injuries claim against Supermac’s after nine years following a review of CCTV footage of the incident.

news.title: Mary Regan: It was clear this was a hugely tense moment for Zelensky who – between handshakes – was being updated ‘hour to hour’ on talks with Putin
news.summary: As he stepped out of his car and onto the red carpet at Áras an Uachtaráin, Volodymyr Zelensky unclenched his phone from his palm and handed it over to one of his team, before proceeding to shake hands with President Catherine Connolly.

news.title: When do parents need to talk to their children about pornography? You need to start that conversation sooner than you think
news.summary: Most parents accept that when a child or teenager encounters pornography early or inadvertently, their developing sense of sexual identity, intimacy, consent and body image can be shaped by distorted and unrealistic images.

news.title: ‘We put our heart and soul into this, so reading it was upsetting’ – can Tripadvisor reviews still make or break Irish businesses?
news.summary: Tripadvisor reviews of the hotel are scathing. 'Hygiene is zero. Algae on all steps, slippery and hazardous. Toilet and bathroom really dirty. Breakfast had mould on avacado (sic) and tomato'

news.title: Loyalist group calls for GAA president Jarlath Burns to resign over Kilmichael commemoration speech
news.summary: A loyalist advocacy group has called on the GAA president to resign for attending the annual Kilmichael commemoration in Co Cork.

news.title: ‘I was working seven days a week’ – Síomha Ní Ruairc on leaving Ireland AM and launching new podcast while pregnant
news.summary: Broadcaster, podcaster and Gaeilgeoir Síomha Ní Ruairc has described how she realised that something had to give when she was working seven days a week while pregnant.

news.title: Fly In, Fly Out: ‘I made $141,000 in nine months – and had two months off at Christmas’
news.summary: FIFO aka ‘Fly In, Fly Out’ - and hopefully make a lot of money in the process.
